COACH.Definition: a large four-wheel carriage usually pulled by a horse

CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: conditions or events that affect a situation

RECAP.Definition: give the main points of a description or situation

TENSION.Definition: a situation of nervousness and hate

OVERNIGHT.Definition: happening as if in a single night, suddenly

PACE.Definition: the speed at which something moves

FLINTLOCK.Definition: an old type of gun using a very small piece of fire (a spark) to shoot

PISTOL.Definition: a small gun that is fired from one hand

HOLDER.Definition: the person who holds the gun

TRIGGER.Definition: a part of a gun that activates the firing mechanism when pressed

FLINT.Definition: a piece of black stone used to produce small pieces of fire

GUNPOWDER.Definition: a mixture of explosive materials in the form of a powder

FUSE.Definition: a cord or string which is burned easily, made to carry flame from one end to the other

THREATEN.Definition: tell someone that they would kill them unless they did what they wanted

AMBUSHING.Definition: suddenly attacking after hiding and waiting

CRUCIALLY.Definition: in a way that is very important

FAME.Definition: the state of being widely known

FATE.Definition: the outcome of a situation for someone

TRAITOR.Definition: someone not loyal to his own country

HUNG, DRAWN AND QUARTERED.Definition: hanged by the neck and had his body cut into pieces

HUNG.Definition: killed by tying a rope around his head, attached from above and removing the support from beneath

GENEROUSLY.Definition: in a way that shows willingness to give money

HANGING.Definition: tying a rope around his head, attached from above and removing the support from beneath

TOMBSTONE.Definition: a stone used to mark a grave or the place where someone is buried
